pitrou commented on pull request #6870: ARROW-8299: [C++] Reusable "optional ParallelFor" function for optional use of multithreading
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6870#discussion_r405456217
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/util/parallel.h
 ##########
 @@ -44,5 +44,21 @@ Status ParallelFor(int num_tasks, FUNCTION&& func) {
   return st;
 }
 
+// A parallelizer that takes a `Status(int)` function and calls it with
+// arguments between 0 and `num_tasks - 1`, in sequence or in parallel,
+// depending on the input boolean.
+
+template <class FUNCTION>
+Status OptionalParallelFor(bool use_threads, int num_tasks, FUNCTION&& func) {
+  if (use_threads) {
+    return ParallelFor(num_tasks, func);
 
 Review comment:
   `std::forward<FUNCTION>(func)` can be more efficient.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

liyafan82 commented on pull request #6870: ARROW-8299: [C++] Reusable "optional ParallelFor" function for optional use of multithreading
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6870#discussion_r405487355
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/util/parallel.h
 ##########
 @@ -44,5 +44,21 @@ Status ParallelFor(int num_tasks, FUNCTION&& func) {
   return st;
 }
 
+// A parallelizer that takes a `Status(int)` function and calls it with
+// arguments between 0 and `num_tasks - 1`, in sequence or in parallel,
+// depending on the input boolean.
+
+template <class FUNCTION>
+Status OptionalParallelFor(bool use_threads, int num_tasks, FUNCTION&& func) {
+  if (use_threads) {
+    return ParallelFor(num_tasks, func);
 
 Review comment:
   Awesome! 
   Thank you for the good suggestion.

comments.body: [~wesm] I notice the assignee is left empty. May I try to provide a patch for this issue?
